title: Are Labour embarrassed at being exposed as undemocratic Brexit wreckers? Of course not
text:
It is perhaps a sign of Labour’s sensitivity to the charge of “betraying Brexit” that many of its supporters so frequently point the finger of blame at others. Theresa May’s unloved Withdrawal Agreement was rejected three times by the Commons, they point out, because of the “Spartans”, the die-hard Brexiteers of the European Research Group (ERG).

This was never entirely true, of course. Even Mrs May’s first attempt, in January 2019, to seek approval for her deal would have succeeded if Labour MPs had supported it. By the third time of asking, on March 29 this year, some of the Spartans – notably Boris Johnson and Jacob Rees-Mogg – had reluctantly come to the conclusion that a bad deal was better...
description: It is perhaps a sign of Labour’s sensitivity to the charge of “betraying Brexit” that many of its supporters so frequently point the finger of blame at others.
